Side Effects: Sleeplessness_ slight jitters early on_ both resolved after 3-4 weeks.  Blood pressure decreased (this was a great plus!)
Comments: If the impotent SSRI drugs aren't cutting it_ do yourself the biggest favor possible_ and try an MAOI like Parnate.  Find a psychiatrist that has experience with them and therefore knows how straight-forward they are to use.  Practically zero diet changes_ just caution about a couple things. Contact me if you'd like regarding any questions/concerns.  Parnate (Tranylcypromine) has given me my life back.

Side Effects: Loss of appetite_ irritability_ difficulty sleeping_ weight loss_ anxiety
Comments: This drug has saved my life. I have tried everything under the sun_ this is amazing. The side effects suck but are manageable and well worth the outcome. For the first 3 weeks I felt like I was on speed_ but that has subsided now. The diet is annoying and confusing as their seems to be so much different information. I have a home blood pressure machine now so that i can keep an eye on my blood pressure.

Side Effects: I just developed serious stomach issues. I think it's because I'm not rrally following the diet right. I've gotten all types of medical testing done. Blood work_ ultrasound of my liver_ and gallbladder. Endoscopy with biopsies. Catscan from a gastroenterologist. So far the blood work_ ultrasound came out normal. I still get terrible stomach aches when I rat roughage. Salad_ fruit_ etc. I have to stick to this diet right to the t. If I don't take Parnate_ I feel terrible. Yesterday_ I didn't take any_ and I felt soo panicky. I noticed immediately. This morning_ I took my 20mg_ and I'll take my 30mg in the afternoon and 20mg in the evening. For me_ I would rather stop eating these forbidden foods_ than suffer with panic_ and depression. But_ my stomach always hearts when I eat. Hopefully_ I'll get to the bottom of this. No matter what_ I will stay on Parnate. I don't care if I have to live on baby food. My mental health is detrimental to me. I'll keep plugging away until I find out what the hell is wrong with my stomach. In the interim_ I'll stick to this diet.

Reason: depression. Had been on SSRI for 27
Side Effects: It is a wonderful Tablet! Since I have been on it_ I have less anxiety  attacks. I feel wonderful on it!
Comments: I get diarrhoea quite often_ when we treat ourselves_ and eat out. Maybe the food was old in the fridge?

Side Effects: I do feel cold more than usual. No other side effects..
Comments: Parnate saved my life!!  I could hardly go more than five miles from my home without panicking.  I had not left the county in more than 20 years. I can now travel outside of my "safe zone" and am finally living again. I feel like I was in a coma and woke up. Thank God I found Parante.
started nicotine patch 8 month ago and immediately lost any desire to smoke.  patch continues.  anyone else had this happen?

Side Effects: First 4 weeks excessive tiredness. So much so that I was unable to work. Still have some afternoons where I am very sleepy but I'm still adjusting doses and the times when I take it and it's much better.  I've found that EXACT timing of the dose can make or break my energy level in the afternoon. The magic combo for me seems to be 20mg. between 9:30 and 10:30am and the other 20mg must be taken between 12 and 1 pm. If I don't take the second dose at that time_ most times I feel like I want to take a nap. As for my depression it is working very well when nothing else did anymore. However_ Parnate is not a quick fix like many of the newer drugs and it took about six weeks to really notice a difference. Now_ I feel 90% better. I almost gave up initially because it seemed so slow to work and I always felt exhausted but I forced myself to hang on because I have been on everything and this was the last class of drugs left for me. I'm glad I did.
Slight foggy feeling (went away after 4 days) Slight Insomnia_ waking early_ Anaorgasmia_ slight acne_ Afternoon Sleepiness.
Comments: I have not been on Parnate for very long but so far it has increased my mood and ability to live life without the normal dull-drums. I increase to 30MG next week so hopefully side effects will go away and feelings will continue to improve.

Side Effects: Some overstimulation_ on the mild side.
Comments: Been taking antidepressants for decades.  First MAOI I've been given.  What a wonderful med!  Mild sleeplessness only side effect_ and for the first time in my life I feel like a normal_ non-depressed person.

Side Effects: Fatigue/Tiredness
Comments: Parnate helped me but the fatigue side effect was just too much. I just switched to Nardil and there are no side effects so if Parnate doesn't work for you_ try Nardil and Vice Versa.

Side Effects: Yellow_ burning and swollen tongue
Dry mouth_ insomnia_ weight gain_ acne_ poor night vision_ some irritability_ fogginess at work (loss of sleep?)
Light headed;constipation_ feeling bloated; tired in afternoon ; weight gain

Stimulant induced anxiety which would push me toward compulsive behavior. It messed with my cognition. It didn't slow my thinking like benzos or alcohol do_ but made me slightly delusional. The worst side effect was emotional instability. Also: cold intolerance_ reduced appetite_ sweating_ insomnia_ headaches_ and dry mouth all of which were present but tolerable if the drug would have been effective.
Comments: I took Parnate by itself_ with adderall_ with klonopin and adderall_ and with buspar. In every situation_ I felt good for part of the day and terrible for the other part. This drug might have worked if it weren't for the short term stimulation it causes. Although it didn't work for me_ I think this drug would bring great for people who can handle the short term stimulation it causes. It didn't make me numb at all like SSRIs can

Side Effects: Naseua dizzines
It took a few weeks to get used to. I had bouts of dizziness the first 3 weeks of taking the drug.
Comments: It is the most effective anti-depressant and anti-anxiety medicine I have ever taken. See psychotropical.com for more information.

Side Effects: GREAT night's sleep_ UNLESS I take Parnate too late (maybe after about 5:30 p.m.)_ then very poor night's sleep. Strange paradox!
Comments: Helps a lot_ but still some periods of deep depression.  Addition of Lithium those times is very effective. I also take Lamictal.  The most striking effect of the Parnate was IMMEDIATE AND COMPLETE CESSATION OF severe_ frequent_ lengthy MIGRAINES! Gone with any of the MAO-I's.  Dietary restrictions are not nearly as bad as once thought; old information is not necessarily accurate. Many cheeses_ coffee_ chocolate_ bananas_ etc. are fine.On the other hand_ have Captopril handy in case there is a problem. I avoid a few things such as hard cheeses_ yet over 10 years of MAO-I's my only problems have been with leftover meat.  Be really vigilant about Demerol if you have a medical procedure done_ since many medical staff have no idea about the dangerous interaction.  Ask questions and be assertive.  I have had several close calls.

Side Effects: Fast heartbeat when I first take in the morning. I have a feeling of energy right away. Bad dry mouth. Insomnia at night.
Comments: I have suffered from depression and anxiety disorders since I was child. I was also diagnosed with Borderline Personality disorder a couple of years ago. I have been hospitalized 20 times for suicide attempts and threatening suicide over the past 18 years. I have been on too many antidepressants to count. I have also had ECT treatments. I tried Nardil_ but didn't like a couple of the side effects. I have only been on parnate for a week_ but so far the major symtom that I notice is Insomnia. One of the first nights I was lucky if I even slept an hour. I do feel energetic  when I first take pill and my heart beats fast. My mood does seem good and I haven't been worrying about things. I am hoping some of the bad side effects will go away and this will really help me.

Side Effects: Mild acne_ sleep difficulties_ dilated pupils

After 20 years of taking other meds this has worked best. It irradicated OCD %100.  However I did have depression hit me after about 7 months of it working. I could not tolerate a higher dose. Augmenting it with 400 mg of seroquel got rid of depression plus I sleep great. Only gained 5 lbs from seroquel. Did not gain or lose weight with parnate. First we tried lamictal but my depression did not get better.
Insomnia_ dizziness and irregular heartbeat (from blood pressure effects; went away after a few weeks)_ dry mouth_ constipation_ hair loss on legs
Comments: Parnate has worked better than anything I've taken in the past 10 years at giving me some emotion back.  Early on I actually gained some feeling back_ feelings I hadn't had since I was a kid.  But as I've continued taking it these feelings have started to wane.  With a half-life of around 2.5 hours_ I'm thinking I might see if my pdoc will push my dose to 30 mg twice a day.  I'm currently on lamictal also_ but I can't tell if it's augmenting the parnate or not.  If I could experience those initial feelings again on a regular basis_ I'd welcome all the side effects I've experienced so far.

Side Effects: Insomnia (2 hours sleep a night typical)Aggression (hey_ it is an amphetamine after all)Soy sauce and vintage cheese sensitivity
Comments: The only drug to actually help with my persistant suicidal ideation. Was told ECT was the only option until an elderly psychiatrist tried it. Unlike most antidepressants I've been on it's activating - no sedation at all. This isn't good though - in Australia benzodiazepines are frowned upon_ so as a result I drink - a lot - to actually sleep. If you do try to push through it (such as I am now - 40 hours straight without sleep) please don't drive - your judgement is impaired similar to a truck driver taking methamphetamine.Dietary restrictions have been pleasantly minor. I can eat as many preserved meats as I like. Cloudy beer only raises my BP slightly. The major problems have been soy sauce and aged cheese. Colby cheese is fine and I eat the stuff by the block now. Brandy raises my BP significantly so I can only have one serve now.Aggression has never been in my personality_ but happens on Parnate. I normally back down when yelled at_ but become strongly defensive on Parnate. My wife recently compared me to her former partners and I effectively told her if she wasn't so promiscuous_ how the fudge would she know? I don't become violent towards other people_ but I did throw the 50KG BBQ about ten metres effortlessly.

Side Effects: I'm one of the very unlucky users of Parnate that had hypertension symptoms for no reason.  Every dose would send my BP to 155-160 over 90-95.  My pulse would slow to almost 55 bmp.  I would become flushed and have very shallow breathing.  After only a few days of use_ I stopped taking Parnate.
Comments: Moving onto Nardil. Parnate my very well work for others so do not let my reactions and experience discourage you from trying this.  We are all different.  What doesn't work for me_ may work for you.  Pay close attention to how you feel after taking Parnate.  Do yourself a favor (when taking ANY MAOI) and spend $50 and get yourself a blood pressure monitor.  I would have never known I was having issues with hypertension (no headaches at all)

Side Effects: Bad depression in the morning before I take it and after each dose wears off.
Severe hair loss - it's coming out by the handful every time I wash it; for the first month_ severe tiredness every day around 4-5 p.m. - this went away
Comments: Parnate saved my life.  Like so many others_ I have been on every single drug_ and frustrated - my last psychiatrist said the only option left was ECT.  This is so crazy to me now!  I have a fantastic doctor who prescribed Parnate --- and I have ADD_ so I also take Adderall.  I have had no problems whatsoever with any interaction.  When she prescribed Parnate_ I was at my lowest mood ever - suicidal thoughts and overwhelming depression.  The Parnate lifted my mood like no other anti-depressant ever has.  Yes_ I'll never be able to eat sushi or at a Japanese restaurant again_ which is a bummer.  But it gave me a life back_ when I had given up completely.  I feel angry that nobody ever suggested MAOIs before!  I have been seen by psychiatrists since I was a teenager for major depressive disorder_ and I have been on various antidepressants since I was 18 years old_ and Parnate is a godsend!

Side Effects: Slight dizziness and some hypotension early on.
Comments: Helped much more for anxiety than other drugs I have taken in the last year (celexa_ pristiq_ wellbutrin_ remeron and Viibryd.  I feel like this drug is in a whole different category as far as horsepower to get rid of the anxiety.  Still to be determined how it will take care of my other depression symptoms_ but for anxiety nothing can touch it.  Good luck finding someone to prescribe it without going through a checklist of all the newer drugs first.

Side Effects: Afternoon fatigue during the first couple of weeks which has dissappeared. A small amount of dry mouth_ easy to deal with.
Comments: This medication has been an absolute life saver. I have tried almost every medication inthe psychotropic arsenal_ several doctors_ and Parnate has relieved nearly every symptom that I have suffered from for the last 22 years. The grass is green_ the sky blue_ I wake up early every morning_ motivated_ hobbies are fun again_ appetite control (have lost 16 lbs in the 5 weeks I have been taking it)_ I can concentrate on work and tasks_ and I could go on. I have used EMSAM and Nardil also_ but for me Parnate is far superior to both. EMSAM too stimulating and caused easy agitation and Nardil made me want to sleep all the time with rediculous weight gain. Parnate has my highest recommendation (generic or brand_ I've had both with no difference).

Side Effects: dry mouth_ insomnia
Comments: estimulant_ really strongbut still insufficientmaybe I need a higher dose

Side Effects: 13 yrs total now down to 20 mg. My posting before must have been too long as it didn't save. I had another tyramine  reaction... middle eastern food. Someone else ordered and I never thought of what marinated meant. 10 minutes after the meal I had a head ache like never before and my blood pressure was way out there. It meant a trip to the emergency room. The triage people were not very nice...but once I got the med to bring my blood pressure down I recovered quickly. Hair loss continues but not as much now at 20? or it is my age.
Comments: To the person wanting encouragement... keep on. It may take awhile. It might help to keep a journal so you can go back and read it later and find that you are improving. Be reasonable with the diet. New guidelines are not as strict as the old ones. A tiny tiny bit of something you like as a  treat might work. Or if it is something you don't like_ use your diet as an excuse to not have it! Like Herring or liver!

Side Effects: bad taste after eating - getting used to itdry mouthhair loss - fortunately I have plenty!feel cold more easilyappetite loss - a good thing
Comments: I have been depressed for years and although I tried about 12 different meds and combinations_ as well as several sessions of EST_ was non-responsive.  Dr. at hospital recommended this "old" drug Parnate; said its benefits might outweigh its side-effects/restrictions.   I don't miss cheese or coldcuts; I do miss salted fish and soya sauce.  But not enough to give up Parnate.  For the first time in years_ I feel like a normal person.   I didn't even know how depressed I was until it went away.   I can't believe what a difference this has made to my life.   I already had hereditary hypertension_ but was already on meds for it and have not had to adjust them any.  I was already on Imovane for sleeping so am not experiencing any insomnia that some have reported.  It took about a month before I really felt well; so don't give up after just a week or two.   For me_ this was a life-saver.

Side Effects: Tired in the early evening
Comments: Parnate is an effective medication.  I do take it with a small dose of Zyprexa (1.25 mg).  The zyprexa will make you gain a lot of weight. So_ if you go this route only take the lowest dose.The Parnate would seem effective most of the time but then become less effective.  I would up the dose... now up to 60 mgs.  Then I DISCOVERED THAT CINNAMIN WASHS OUT PARNATE.  Only Dr Bob memtions this important fact.  SinceI stopped eating cinnamin Parnate is effective daily.  I do not eat chesse_ soy or aged meants.  I not not drink wine or tap beer.   Now NO CINNAMIN.

Side Effects: I find Parnate very activating. Hair loss has been significant (this time.) I am glad to read others have had the same thing. To help the insomnia_ my doctor and I worked out a plan to take most of the 30 mg early in the day. I take 20 in the morning and the other 10 about 2 pm.  I still sleep less than before_ but that is ok.
Comments: I tried everything. Most things helped a little. Even lithium. The lithium took care of the depression but I got so shaky it was not good. I took another medication that was making me bald which is not ok with me. I took Parnate for about 8 years the first time_ very very slowly decreasing the dose and still doing great. After about 5 years I recognized the depression was coming back. I went back to the doctor_ we started on the 30 mg and in about 1 month I felt much better. Now_ 9 months on t30 mg I don't even think about it.. I just throw the pills in my mouth and love life again.

Side Effects: Always cold_ insomnia_ dry mouth_ sexual side effects_ and deminishing benefits.
Comments: The drug was helpful at first but over a relatively short time I needed to up the dose until the doctor siad I hit my limit at 60.Now he is puting me back on Nardil... which was more effectivebut had a worse sexual side effect.  The doctor claims that this side effect will go away in time. >>>? Best Wishes Gang.

Side Effects: Other than feeling chilled all the time_ fatigue was a constant issue. Parnate worked well for my panic disorder. I had been on parnate for three years when out of nowhere the worst headaches came on suddenly( no relation to parnate) neurologists believe I had a bout w/ cluster headaches. They lasted 22 days and since I was on parnate_ they couldn't treat them. The doctors were blocked because of all the drug interactions. Needless to say I was in and out of the hospital to be on iv w/ dialoded for 22 days to cover the pain. If these intact were clusters_ I couldn't stay on an MAOI. This was an easy decision to make since the headaches felt just as painful as giving birth. I did a quick 2 1/2 wk ween off and have been parnate free for 1 week now. Yes_ the anxiety is back. So parnate did do it's job. But I'll take panic( although aweful) over clusters anyday.

Acute blood pressure spikes when starting first initial dosing_ which disappeared after a couple days. Some hypo-tension_ afternoon fatigue_ anhedonia_ cold intolerance_ and memory recall problems have surfaced.
Comments: First anti-depressant/psychiatric medication to work for me... EVER. Tried everything from SSRI/SSNI/TCA's_ mood stabilizers_ anti-psychotics to stimulants and even NDMA antagonists.. Name it_ I've tried it. The first 4 weeks I felt clear_ motivated_ and best of all NORMAL. Fatigue has been my biggest complaint_ but on some days I am side-effect free. Memory recall is bothersome to some degree_ but memory seems to be improving over time. The first 4 weeks were interrupted by bereavement_ which I am still dealing with now. I believe if it wasn't for Parnate_ I'd be in a much scarier place than all the places I've been over the past 5 years while dealing with atypical depression.

Side Effects: Insomnia for the first couple of months. .5mg Ativan at night helps a lot. Sensitivity to cold (which is totally bearable and seems to be common). Otherwise very few compared to other antidepressants (no fatigue_ dry mouth_ constipation_ sexual side effects).
Comments: This drug completely changed my life. I was diagnosed at 16 and have tried every SSRI and "new" drug on the market (Cymbalta in particular was a disaster)_ and it was just last year that a psych finally went outside the box and suggested this. Before this I was constantly tired (body and mind)_ had poor cognitive function_ and going to the grocery store took every ounce of energy I could muster. My depression was obviously resistant to treatment so why an MAOI wasn't suggested earlier is beyond me. All drugs have drawbacks_ so avoiding a very small selection of foods is a small price to pay in exchange for overall mental health. I have had no issues with interactions even having eaten many of the off limits foods in small amounts (not that I'm testing it). If you have never tried an MAOI and haven't found relief from the more mainstream medications_ talk to your doctor about this.

Side Effects: Parnate was the 1st (& only) anti~d that has ever helped me. I felt 'normal'. But sleep disorders and eventual constant sedation forced me to discontinue. I still question why. The 2nd time I tried it (year later) it sedated me from day one and discontinued after 3 weeks.
Unstable sleep cycle (insomnia alternating with hypersomnia)_ intolerance to cold_ mild tachycardia_ mild hypotension_ dilated pupils
Comments: I find it fascinating that all of the low ratings were given by people who did not reach a therapeutic dose of the drug for a standard amount of time and therefore can't really judge whether or not it "worked." Yes_ Parnate can be a difficult medication to take. But once you've experienced the Parnate response_ you'll be amazed that you ever complained about side effects. This drug works if you let it work.

Side Effects: 2.5 Hr Half Life-take 2 FID/2 Q4hrs. Neg.few esp.compared to Nardil(mega SE)-was on for 20 yrs; Parnate mild orthostatic hypotension_ hypomania/good-like rather than not being able to get out of bed-urinary hestitancy. Been on 5 yrs. tot. but stopped_ tried Cymbalta; NO_ stay on Parnate-"most potent REM blocker of any meds" (I still dream too much as I have REM sleep disorder) and everyone with any depression has an overative brain-too much REM (PET SCAN shows too much glucose being used anyone depressed-only with remission of depression does glucose metab. return norm-Deep Brain Stimulation fixes-"cures depression" and will replace ECT). Overactive REM from whatever cause_ excessive glucose uptake/use-overactive kappa system_ ie_ not enough natural endorphins-Buprenorphine/Subutex tremendously helped my TRD as it's a kappa antagonist-blocker.  Newer meds don't block REM as well only Parnate (MAOI B + A with preference to B so more DA-dopamine-great for libido_ but
Comments: The World Health Organization_ WHO_ has recognized that "Suicide will be the number "2 cause of deaths second only to heart disease by the year 2020." It's 10 years from now. I need to get writing my autobiography as I have additional techniques that no psychiatrist ever mentioned to me to treat my TRD with anxiety; Sleep deprivation for 1-2 nights will make most feel 100% normal except for sleepiness-reduces glucose levels to normal in brain-as soon as one gets any amount of sleep-depression returns; Cold Water Therapy-decreases glucose metabolism in the brain- increases NE-endorphins-enkephalins in the brain and wakes one up_ revitalized and is good for the immune system-depressed patients are at risk-as it suppresses immunity; Physical Exercise decreases glucose in the brain_ increases all monoamines NE_5HT_DA+GABA-increases endorphins+enkephalins and over a long period downsizes the overactive kappa receptors and sweating cools off the overactive brain too.  Ask away-I've had severe TRD+anxiety+somatic symptoms since 15y/o currently 44y/o_ medically trained-allopathic+naturpathic. Had 80 ECT's 18y/o + 19y/o without success+have tried over "100 psychotherapeutic drugs" alone+combination-even non FDA approved ones from other parts of the world_ other treatment from spiritual John of God in Brazil-you name-tried it.

Side Effects: Parnate has allowed meto be somewhat normal_ the rest are my quirks. Tried switching several times due tomy docs_ never worked. I had to plead them to keep me on. I'm on veteran care.  I've had 5 headaches_ the bad ones_ due to eating unknown aged foods_ those really stink!  Concerned about my libido_ porn_ and question the morality of it!

initially: afternoon tiredness and insomnia both have gone away for the most part but i still require very little sleep maybe 4-5 hrs.i still have: a "speed" like feeling when i initially take it_ will flush and sweat_ no appetite_ weight loss_ withdrawal symptoms sometimes occur before I can even take my next dosage which involve "brain zaps" and crying episodes_ high sex drive_ dry mouth
Comments: I suffered almost my entire life with sometimes crippling anxiety and depression. From the age of 14 until 30 I have been on almost every medication and medication combo. This drug gave me back my life. They were looking at ECT before they started me on this and it truly is a wonder drug. The side effects for me are pretty severe but_ it's so worth it to feel this wonderful when I never thought I would know happiness or at least be able to live a semi normal life. I must admit I follow the diet very loosely and ive been told not everyone can do that but I haven't had any issues aside from eating a 2 day old hotdog once and you will definitely know if you eat something you shouldnt.

Side Effects: blurred vision_ emotional blunting_ short term memory problems_ worsened ADD_ aggressiveness_ irritability_ low blood pressure_ derealization_ depersonalization_ insomnia_ fatigue
Comments: The weird thing about the medication was that I seemed to get different side effects on different days. Some days I was really aggressive and had insomnia_ some days I was emotionally blunted and slept like a baby. I had blurred vision throughout and stopped the medication (with docs approval) mostly because of that and the episodes of aggressiveness. I can see why it works for well for some people because it is very strong and it did help some with my depression_ anxiety_ and motivation problems_ but the side effects were too severe for me to continue the med. I still have blurred vision_ memory problems_ and worsened ADD 3 weeks after discontinuing the medication which is very worrisome. If you are sensitive to medications like me (I have tried many different medications)_ I would advise against going the MAOI route.

Side Effects: Found I had high blood pressure side effects w/some on the list but not others.  Soy sauce is a major culprit_ as is sauerkraut.
Comments: I'm 60 yrs. old and before taking Parnate I could never deal with the depression or the side effects of other medication.  I can live w/the dietary constrictions easily because it has helped with depression and mood stabilization for so long with me.

Side Effects: none!
Comments: saved my life more than once.

Side Effects: Major increase in blood pressure at all times; had to go on a beta blocker just to be able to continue taking the med. Insomnia. Major anxiety upon discontinuation (which had only been a minor issue previously).
Comments: I realize parnate has been a life-saver for a lot of people_ but it was a horrible drug for me! My blood pressure immediately rose to dangerous levels up initiation of treatment_ so my dr. put me on a beta blocker just to stabilize my bp enough to continue taking the drug. After 6 weeks at 40mg/day with NO improvement in my depression_ I abruptly stopped taking it. No withdrawel symptoms per se_ but my blood pressure_ which had been normal prior to taking parnate_ has remained elevated 2 months after discontinuation and my anxiety levels have skyrocketed. I had minor anxiety prior to taking parnate_ but never like I've had since stopping treatment. It seems to have permanently changed my body/brain chemistry. Example -- I tried to resume taking wellbutrin after stopping parnate (after a 2 week washout) and while the wellbutrin did help improve my mood as it had done in the past_ my anxiety was so increased that I could no longer take wellbutrin_ leaving me in a bad situation. I am now trying various serotonin-type drugs to help quell my anxiety so I can resume treatment with wellbutrin at some point (that's the only drug that's helped me much over the years_ but had pooped out on me)_ but so far _ not having any luck. MAOI's are generally known for decreasing a patient's blood pressure_ but be aware that for a few people_ it can majorly increase your blood pressure and that effect may not go away even after ceasing treatment...be careful!

Side Effects: Dry mouth quit after 3yrs_ Hair loss upped protein intake helped_ Hard falling asleep need meds._sometimes dizzy_
Comments: I started on Nardill which dropped my blood pressure saver lie. Then on Parnate it happened not as bad. Figured out black licorice was the problem. It's one of ther bad foods. I can tolerate most other foods in moderation and not at the same time except red wine even something cooked with red wine. I have a restricted diet anyway from having gastric bypass surgery 7yrs ago so I'm not sure that some of my symptoms are related to that. I am going thru menopause too.

Side Effects: no circadium rhytmn (sleep in naps like cat)_ major libido increase_ appetite increase_ progrogressive cognitive abilitity over time_ no clincial response until nearly twice clinical dose.
Comments: Slight need to up/down dose with body weight_ Weight gain is major issue; no manic symptoms_ but definate acceleration of word and concept recall and ablility to learn after years. Dose of Li help stablize and even effect of this shortacting drug.The time a day regimen a laborior_ but worth it. 5 BP machinse_ 1 in car_ in boat_ 2 in hours_ 1 in man-bag_ etc. Been on MAOi for over over 20 years.

Side Effects: Very sleepy at first_ especially after eating a meal.  Dry mouth that I still have which I have learned to live with.
Comments: Parnate saved my life.  I suffered severe depression for over 30 years before I finally found this drug after doing my own research in one of my darkest hours. I had been in the wrong group of drugs my entire life.  I sincerely wish a doctor would have figured that out sooner.  Parnate was effective for me within a few days.  The world was just lighter.  I finally realized how "normal" people feel.  Parnate should not be a drug of last resort.  I lost years of my life without knowing about it and the medical community did not mention it.

Side Effects: In the first 1-2 weeks_ extreme fatigue (not so much tiredness) in the afternoons. I could barely keep my eyes open. I also had trouble falling asleep initially_ although did not feel tired in the mornings. An odd side effect was feeling very cold_ particularly at night time_ when others reported the room temperature was fine. Overall_ there were none of the horrible side effects associated with tricyclics or SSRIs.
Comments: I've tried SSRIs_ SNRIs_ tricyclics and others_ with limited success. After reading the positive comments on here_ I thought Parnate would prove to be a success for me. However_ after 3.5 weeks_ I can't say I feel any better_ and in fact feel that I'm deteriorating. I've ordered Stablon from an overseas pharmacy and hope that proves to more helpful.

Side Effects: Extreme fatigue_ drowsiness and inability to concentrate to the point that I can no longer work full time.  Extreme water retention ~ 10 lbs gained in 1 week.
Comments: After trying many other types/combinations of anti-depressants and ECT over the past 19 yrs_ I have never felt worse than I have since switching to Parnate.  Maybe these side effects will go away with time but I have never experienced anything similar with other medications.

Side Effects: When I first started taking it my vision would "roll" like a frame by frame film when I was driving.  With time_ that went away.
Comments: I'd been through every medication available and 9 electric shock therapies in a 3 week time frame.  Nothing was helping.  I was cycling down further each time and staying there longer.  Parnate keeps me from cycling and has me on an even keel unless I'm experiencing a lot of stress in my life.  I'm not "happy"_ but I'm able to function and interact.  When I couldn't go to sleep or stay asleep the doctor put me on Neurontin 400 mg and it helps most of the time.  I break the Parnate dosage into 2 parts_ one at 8 am and one at lunch.  I take the larger dose in the morning.

Side Effects: urinary frequency_ esp. at night (every hour last night!)_ urinary hesitancy_ feeling very cold (cold sensitivity- only when A/C air blowing on me) alternating with very hot_ decreased appetite (YAY!!!!)_ increased libido (double YAY!)_ some odd hand/leg flailing movements when sleeping (wakes me up).
Comments: I've been depressed all of my life. I'm 38. I was on the EMSAM (MAOI) patch and it was the first thing that ever worked for me (20 years of my life wasted on trial after long trial of the "new!" antidepressants) and it felt like a miracle but it only lasted a year. I was at max dose and augmentation strategies (ritalin_ adderal_ provigil_ abilify_ seroquel_ xanax) did not help. I've only been taking Parnate for a week but on day 3 it was like BOOM!- life changed again. I hope it lasts!!! I feel like a person again instead of an immobile hermit!  Doc was hesitant about trying MAOI- I told HIM about the patch. He was afraid I'd intentionally kill myself by eating the wrong stuff.  If your doctor gives you this line_ simply say_ "Well_ if this works I won't want to kill myself_ will I?!"

Side Effects: I am sooo tired I cant think straight and dont care to go anywhere or do anything. I am praying this mediation helps me. I have been on numerous antidepressants.
insomnia which decreased over time
Comments: Best AD available.  Worked for me_ finally_ after 20 yrs of depression. It did "poop-out" after 1-2 yrs; then on many other AD's with Effexor as the only one to come close. Helped me feel energy again to deal w/ life.  Later was tried on the generic_ which did nothing.  Didn't realize the brand-generic disconnect. Now am looking forward to returning to Brand name Parnate.  MAOI's are the only true antidepressants.  I would have died without it.

Side Effects: Sleep Disturbances at 30 mg or more
Comments: I've tried nearly all the ADs on the market.  NONE of them came close to Parnate in effectiveness.  My nurse & doc said it was the "nuclear weapon" against depression - very effective_ but one of the last resorts.  You MUST pay attention to the warnings and avoid alcohol_ certain other meds & anesthetics_ & certain foods.  After the first course of 30mg/day_ I found I could use 10 mg/day for less side effect danger_ but it still gives me the boost I need.  It is expensive even in generic (less with a drug discount card) but well worth it.  Can have sleep problems (insomnia & strangely_ afternoon drowsiness) at 30 mg or more.

Side Effects: If taken after 3.00pm insomnia can develop.Sensitivity to light(only sometimes) and dry  mouth are the three main symptoms that have effected me over the years.
Comments: I have been on this medication for some time. I have stopped it twice during two pregnancy of which I survived without any problems. After the birth of my first child I  developed post natal depression and the doctor put me on nardil. This helped me a great deal. Then when I was pregnant the second time I stopped taking the medication but as soon as the baby was born I knew the symptoms of depression and I went straight to my doctor who started me on Nardil so I did not suffer the symptoms of depression for long. Then Nardil was taken off the market and my doctor then prescribed Parnate for me which is from the same family as Nardil. Without this medication I would not have been able to survive the normal things that you do from day to day. I have been able to rare a family and work at the same time and if taking a tablet everyday means getting you out of bed and putting a smile on your face then its worth the while.

Side Effects: Orthostatic hypotension_ insomnia and fatigue_ 24/7 jaw clenching_ dilated pupils and blurred vision_ low appetite_ anorgasmia_ choreoathetoid movements (worse at night)_ urinary hesitancy
Comments: I wouldn't be putting up with all these side-effects if my response hadn't been so profound. It wasn't mania; it was a recovery of myself; it was happiness and it was pure and normal. But it pooped out. I'm still playing around with increasing the dose and/or augmenting it with different things.  Dexedrine in small doses has helped with the hypotension.  So does spacing out the Parnate.The choreoathetosis is apparently unusual.A lot of people report a stimulant-like effect from Parnate.  I don't experience this feeling at all_ apart from the magical absense of leaden paralysis and psychomotor slowing.

Side Effects: Cold Sensitivity_ High Blood Pressure (non-diet related)_ slight weight loss (good thing)_ afternoon fatigue (went away)
Comments: Started taking Parnate in December at 10mg.  Taped up 10mg about every 2 to 3 weeks until I reached 60mg.  It helped with depression but didn't necessarily make things more enjoyable.  I felt more focused about getting things done when I had things to do.  It also seemed to really help with self-confidence in social situations.  However at the same time I felt a little empty in the feeling department (not enough serotonin?).  I'd still be on it but I noticed (accidentally really) that an hour or two after each dose my blood pressure was going extremely high (like 170/100).  The only reason I caught this was because I was at a CVS waiting for a script and used their machine out of bordom - it was extemely high. Freaked me out so I bought a BP monitor and sure enough every morning my BP was around 115/75 which is normal but after taking my first dose of Parnate (2x10mg) it would shoot up to at least 160/90.  This wasn't diet related as I checked it for 4 days and made sure I wasn't taking anything even remotely risky for MAOI takers.  Due to that unfortunate side effect my pdoc and I decided to take me off Parnate and we're going to give Marplan a try.  Hopefully that'll work as well as Parnate and w/o the weight gain Nardil is supposed to cause.  I'll post my experience w/ Marplan in a few months.  My pDoc was adamant that my other meds didn't contribute to the BP problem but to be fair I was also taking: Lamictal (200mg)_ Lithium (600mg)_ and Seroquel (100mg).

Side Effects: Some vertigo_ Insomnia_ altered taste of some foods
Comments: Began zoloft about 15 years ago and switched to several SSRIs and SNRIs that all stopped working. Pdoc suggested Parnate in November 2009 and I began with generic that did not work. Once I switched to brand name it worked! I never feel the symptoms of depression i once had although I do have some recurring anxeity that I take .5 mg of Xanax for maybe 5x per week tops. The diet is no big deal to stick to and I lost 18 lbs on it anyway. People say I look great and those who know about my depression say I appear happier and more social. Honestly_ I was tired of crying about whatever was bothering me and never wanting to leave my apartment. I'll stick with Parnate and watch my diet so I can be 'normal'. I strongly advise trying it if SSRIs or SNRIs do not work for you. Find a Pdoc who knows how to prescribe an MAOI since they are not time released you need to take the correct dose at correct intervals during the day.

Side Effects: Restlessness (improved w/ Vitamin B6 and Ambien)_ acne and dry skin/hair (improved w/ B6 and regular skin regimen)_ enhanced libido_ weight gain.
Comments: Best medication I've ever t*ken. Currently combined with dextroamphetamine_ which has not caused any hypertensive crises at all. Doctors are far too ignorant and afraid of MAOIs.

Side Effects: Life saving_ restored libido_ some side effects like any antidepressant_ but Parnate is life giving without side effects of Nardil (more sedating via Gaba_ took Nardil for over 10 years). Reserve Nardil for second choice. Hypertensive and serotonin syndrome way over rated but can happen.
Comments: Ask me what you want.  I've had severe treatment resistant depression (along with anxiety_ lots of somatic symptoms) since 15y/o and currently am 42y/o.  I had about 80 ECT's at 18y/o and 19y/o without success and have tried over 50 psychotherapeutic drugs without success.  I still can have my "not the best days"_ however_ Parnate give me life. and all other MAOIA (not the new "RIMA")Deep Brain Stimulation_ I believe_ will be the cure all.

Side Effects: Nausea and other digestive issues at first_ but they went away after a few weeks. Lost weight_ and have increased energy and desire to do anything (even exercise).
Comments: The reviews from many others at this website are true_ and I believe this drug will work long term. Fall has been an especially tough time for me in the past_ and so far this year no problems. I had to talk my pych. into using this drug (she was scared)_ but  11 years on SSRI's_Tricyclics_etc did little to help me.

Reason: None of the SSRI's have worked
Side Effects: I'm having muscle weakness_ pain and joint pain_ especially at night when I try to go to sleep.  Also need a pill to help me sleep. Has anyone else had this muscle and joint problem?
Comments: I do feel better after trying the SSRI's for 25 years!

Side Effects: Sometimes a bloated feeling_ especially with dairy products; insomnia (trouble both falling asleep and staying asleep) with "crashes" maybe every 6 weeks or so_ where I sleep for 12-16 hours a night for 2 or 3 days.
Comments: Parnate really saved my life. I'm able to hold down a job and interact with people and life in a marginally normal way. I still have some anxiety_ and there are spells when it doesn't seem to work. I notice that some people on this site have had success with Klonopin for sleep and anxiety issues_ so maybe I will talk to my doctor about that. I wish I'd discovered this ten years earlier.

Side Effects: Irritability_ anger_ aggressiveness_ euphoria that felt like it bordered on manic_ reduced appetite (forgetting to eat sometimes)_ vertigo_ mild nausea_ reduced sleep (5 1/2 hours)_ 'strangeness' in personal interractions - missing cues_ making unconnected responses. Chest pain during exercise initially.  Increased bowel activity in the morning (usally two evacuations within an hour)_ excessive urination in the mornings_ after two cups of tea. Improved ejaculation (over tricyclics). Sour stomach.
Comments: My old tricyclic cocktail (Dothep & Tofranil) was causing arrhythmias so Dr. wanted me to change. I thought Tetracyclic_ but Psychiatrist suggested MAOI_ but let me choose which one (strangely). I chose parnate for less toxic nature of side effects over Nardil.  Psychiatrist usually suggests Nardil for being less stimulating.  No great food interractions.  Have eaten chees and avovcado with no ill effects.  Good quality chocolate now puts me to sleep_ and milk_ up until recently_ has helped extend my sleep up to 8 hrs.  Coffee makes me manic/euphoric so now drink tea. However depression has broken through.  Taking even 1/8th of a pill above 10mg increases the irritability_ anger and aggressiveness to an intolerable level. I will be coming off these as soon as my my daughter's 21st birthday later this month is over.  Only Tetracyclics and moclobemide left of antidepressants I haven't tried.  If they don't work then it may be back to the tricyclics and onto heart drugs.  Oh joy oh bliss.

Side Effects: Sex headaches_ inability to exercise_ hair loss_ nervousness_ flat affect_ RAVENOUS INSATIABLE HUNGER_ weight gain_ memory loss_ cognition decline_ headaches_ inability to focus.
Comments: I took three of two pills and had potent side effects for the next 3-4 months.

Side Effects: Initally none really to speak of - biggest difference: no more headaches.  Now_ having swelling and weight gain.  Could tell a huge difference between brand v generic.
Comments: Am on 5 tablets_ 3 at breakfast 2 at lunch...worked up to this dose.  Have bouts of extreme tiredness and can't keep my eyes open.  Sleeping ok when I can get to sleep_ can get up easier in morning even after only a couple of hours.  Most trouble some is NO WEIGHT LOSS - WEIGHT GAIN and swelling now of hands_ feet and face.  I feel like that little girl who ate the blueberries in Willy Wonka!  After being on MAOI's forever this was supposed to be a miracle drug.  Emotionally_ I give it a 9_ physically a negative 10.

Side Effects: dry mouth_ feeling cold (went away)  water retention (minor)manic behaviour on higher doses_ can't drink coffee or alcohol without getting headaches or nausea
Comments: I started with 3x 10mg tabs per day.  Worked like a charm_ but had an immediate loss of appetite_ vertigo_ and manic behaviour.A year later tapered off to 2 per day.  Five years later levelled off to 1x10mg. per day_ and that's where I am right now.On rare occasions I feel the need for an extra dose_ but this happens maybe once or twice a year.  I had tried mannerix about 15 years ago since a new doctor thought parnate had too many interactions.  That lasted about 3 weeks and it was very difficult for me because it did nothing for me.  I was relieved to get back on the parnate.  I was also relieved when I found this website and read other people's reports.  I thought I was one of very few left taking the drug.  I'm always worried they will take it off the market.  Now I see there are many other users.  For me it is a wonder drug.

Side Effects: Some gastrointestinal to begin with but after that only good side effects such as unimagined energy and interest in life - but no sleep. Also lost weight as I lost my appetite - a real bonus. I always put on weight on anti depressants.
Comments: I have had an awful endogenous depression for about 6 years. Have tried everything. I have been on tricyclics most of the time as SSRIs just don't work for me. I just decided after 4 years of tricyclics with no real improvement wasn't good enough and looked around for something else. I was a bit nervous about the alleged side effects of the MAOIs and dire warnings about diet but in the end found that I just needed to avoid red wine and vast amounts of dark chocolate (milk is fine).It was like a miracle cure! I was able to get out of bed_ work 12 hour days_ be interested in life_ rarely had obsessive dark thoughts. The only down side was that I only slept one or 2 hours a night and that was with pills but I was never tired. Parnate was like low level speed. I loved it! After about 4 months I crashed from the lack of sleep and my doctor said to reduce the dose from 30mg to 20mg. 25mg would have been ideal but they don't come in that dose and the pills are coated so cannot be broken in ha

Side Effects: When I first started to take parnate_ I would  faint at any time. I really did have to watch myself. That has passed. I feel much better on parnate than any other drug I tried. It did save my life.
Insomnia above 30 or 40 mg per day.
Comments: In my experience_ Parnate is much more effective than the more commonly prescribed modern antidepressants_ but you must obey the dietary and medication restrictions to avoid serious medical problems. Also check your blood pressure regularly.  Get to the ER quickly with your Parnate pharmacy info sheet if you get a severe headache or other significant symptoms (that your doctor can explain). You should wear a medical alert bracelet or neck pendant (engraved as your doctor says with something like "Taking Parnate")_ or carry a yellow or orange medication card while wearing the bracelet or pendant. (You can get these at some pharmacies or online.) Also tell your dentist that you are taking Parnate_ since it can cause have serious interactions with certain anesthetics.  This may sound a little scary_ but it is worth it if the other meds don't work for you.  If you want to recover from depression_ the medication is only a first step.  You must also greatly simplify your life and m

Side Effects: Hair loss_ always cold_ low blood pressure_ sun sensitivity.
Comments: Has kept my moods more level than other drugs but I feel flat or empty inside. I hate the diet restrictions and the fact that my hair continues to fall out.

Side Effects: none
Comments: it has been a wonder drug for me!  literally saved my life

Side Effects: First course - None at allSecond course - daytime drowsiness_ so much so that i started taking naps for the first time in my life at the age of 23.
Comments: Parnate was probably the best antidepressant i have taken. It is strong_ but lifted me out of a deep dark place in my life.I took the first course for a few months_ and 2 years later took a second course_ again for a few months.The second time i took it_ i found it wasn't as good as the first - drowsiness was a new side-effect_ which i really don;t like. I've never had problems with the food interactions_ not sure why. Ate 3 day old lasagna with blue cheese_ not even a headache. I DON'T recommend this to anyone_ but if you really miss cheese maybe take a little_ and if no headache_ work your way up?...

Side Effects: None
Comments: Parnate has saved my life.  I have tried many medicines for depression but none worked like Parnate does.  Once you understand the food restriction you will do well.  It helped that I didn't drink_ and I don't eat pigs feet.  I do miss taking OT for colds.  But compaired to depression I will live thru a cold.  My doctor agrees that Parnate has made the difference between day and night for me in how I view life.

Side Effects: Dry mouth_ some difficulty sleeping.
Comments: This isn't the miracle drug for me that it was for others_ but it was able to give me a little lift where SSRIs weren't.  It's tough not being able to eat cheese_ but overall it's worth it.  (Can still eat mozzarella and American cheese.) I take 0.5 mg ambien for sleeping but can only take 5x/week to prevent dependence so the weekends can be a little tough for sleeping.

Side Effects: At first_ vertigo (went away)_ weight loss (Okay by me)_ sleeplesness
Comments: I've tried every antidepressant imaginable_ nothing seemed to work. I take 3 tablets a day (10 mgs.) a day. To help with the insomnia_ I first tried ambien_ which didn't work for me for some reason. My doctor put me on Klonopin 1 or 2 as needed to help with anxiety and sleeplesness (But only at bed time!). I feel that the combination of these two medications is life saver! Also_ I've lost 15 lbs. since starting the pills:) I actually want to get out of bed and do things now!:) Highly recommended!!

Side Effects: I have been on Parnate (starting at 5mg_10mg_15mg_ and now have leveled off)It is the first anti depressant that has worked in fifteen years. I have lost 70pounds. I do notice a rapid heartbeat_ my pulse has increased a bit. Coffee seemsto interact after one cup. My doctor would like to switch from Ambien to Klonepinand was addicted to that drug three years ago. He says different anti-depressantswork with  vs against klonepin. Any comments? I have no cravings for sugar or carbsas I did with the newer anti-depressants. The weight simply came off. I find it a strong_ but lifesaving drug. concerned about the pulse and ambien. Still anxiety..
Insomnia_ muddy thinking?_ "flatness"_ memory problems?_ initial weight gain_ frustration w/dietary restrictions_ had to correct nutritional deficiencies due to change in diet from mostly vegetarian.
Comments: After 17 years on mostly lithium and Zoloft with no hospitalizations_ I suffered some personal losses and consequent severe depression in 2004. For 2 years I tried other meds and had bad doctors_ wound up on Parnate for "atypical" reasons. Insomnia was helped by a dx of sleep apnea_ and had lots of therapy. I hate the food restrictions but don't know whether it's worth getting off Parnate and going back to an SSRI/SNRI with all the risks involved and possibly losing some of what I've worked so hard to recover. I welcome comments.

Side Effects: low blood pressure and sleepiness(these happen sometimes after my final dose wears off- it happens to a lesser degree now that I've been on parnate for a year)
Comments: Great antidepressant! IMO should be prescribed much more often.I feel much happier w/this than every ssri I took.  It also lessons social anxiety for me.  It doesn't (for me) have the awful sexual side effects that ssris had. It hasn't caused any weight gain.

Side Effects: horrible taste in mouth all the time
Comments: Started Tranylcypromine (UK name)30mg/daily  2 months ago_ still waiting for it to kick in. I agree with the comments about being 'dull'. A friend said I looked sadder than usual. I suppose he meant the same thing. Being very cautious about food_ lost loads of weight as a result! Being your own cook/baker does help_ you know everything in your shopping basket. Wouldn't describe it in the ecstatic terms some reveiews have used_ unless of course_ when it does kick in...

Side Effects: Insomnia
Comments: Lifesaving drug.  Nothing else (tricyclics_ SSRIs) has anything like it efficacy.  Although it is viewed as 'old fashioned' I think it should be used more.  The side effects_ though real_ are exaggerated and harmless.This is one of those drugs that actually works.

Side Effects: If I take Parnate after 4pm_ I get a strange and agitated sleep.  This is helped by taking 1/4 a clonazepam (or of course by not forgetting to take the tablet!).  Also_ sometimes I get anxiety if I take the tablets (im on 40mg) too close together_ or without food.  But all of these pale in comparison to the depression I had!!  Dry mouth sometimes.
Comments: This drug quite literally saved my life.  I had been on 13 different antidepressants_ in various combinations_ for three years.  None of them worked_ hence my diagnosis of severe atypical treatment resistant depression (whew_ what a title!).  The "atypical" bit came about because i put on weight (lots of it) rather than lost it_ my depression was MUCH worse at night rather than during the day_ and I wasnt particularly melancholic.  As a last resort I researched drugs myself and read about parnate.  THe Dr initially refused to put me on it_ but relented after significant pressure from me.  Within one week most of my "depression" had gone (though the aftereffects of living with depression for 3 years without remission took a lot longer to overcome)_ and I was back to normal.  I was initially on 20mgs (the max dose in new zealand where i live)_ and it stopped working after about 3 months.  THe dr put me up to 40_ and i was fine for 3 years.  Then dr asked me to go down

Side Effects: This drug has had the longest efficacy (2+ years) of anything I've taken.  The dietary restrictions are really not so bad--so long as you eat most of your meals at home.  Restaurants tend to put cheese in everything!  I've had some problems with insomnia and urinary retention_ but the relief from depression is worth almost any side-effect.
Comments: A couple of points:(1) One very interesting strategy that my doctor has suggested_ which has worked four times when Parnate started to "poop out".  At his suggestion_ I have tapered off very rapidly (3-4 days) gone without the drug for a week_ and quickly tapered up to the old dose (60 mg/day.  I have never heard of this idea before_ but it has worked extremely well for me.  (Noting that everyone is different_ and one should do this only under MD direction.)(2) At age 63_ I wonder if I should be increasing the dose.  I've read that dopamine falls off rapidly with age_ and I think that in my case the dopamine increase may be a major feature of the drug. I will consult my MD on this.

Side Effects: dry mouth_ headaches (w/o high BP)_ loss of appetite_ heart palpitations_ often cold (went way)_ water retention_ agitation (went away)
Comments: I was *severely* depressed when I started parnate; after about 3 weeks and a dose of 30mg/day I felt better for about a week... now I feel like I'm "sliding backwards_" don't want to get out of bed in the morning_ don't want to leave my house_ less energy. I'm going up to 40mg_ hoping this will help because SSRI's are pretty useless for me. For the week that I did feel better it was a big improvement... so maybe a higher does will do the trick.

Side Effects: I have been taking it for so long I cannot remember but it was the only medicine I took that did not have nasty or long lasting side affects like other medicines. Of course the only thing you have to watch is certain foods_ OTC products and if you have surgery.  You will be able to determine what you can or cannot eat over time. I would recommend getting a Blood Pressure kit just to be safe.
Comments: The only medicine that worked for my symptoms quickly(within a few weeks)and I tried alot of different meds before Parnate. After 25 years of taking this medicine I just had my first panic attack  My new doctor said that my body is now just metabolizing the medicine in my body faster and I have to increase my dosage from 5 tabs to 6 tabs and possibly 7 tabs on an very other day basis.  I was thinking about switching to a "new" medicine but the Dr. said there is not one better than this.As for all you who have problems trying to sleep at night on Parnate_ I would recommend talking to your doctor about Klonopin.  I have been taking a .25mg 1/2tab for 25 years and never have had a problem with sleeping. Plus you get the added benefit that Klonopin also helps with Panic and Anxiety. Alot of Doctors will not subscribe Klonopin for use over a long period of time because some people can abuse this drug and get addicted to it. If your not an addictive type person I would recommend

Side Effects: Insomnia_ daytime tiredness
Comments: After really hoping this medication would work and getting my hopes up I am really dissatisfied.  One thing I notice is a temporary relief for about one three hours after I take the pill.  But I don't feel happy_ just numb_ but my anxiety is less.  I feel sort of zombie like on this med.  My personality is much duller and my moods are very uneven depending on when I take the pill.

Side Effects: I do have a rapid  heartbeat when I take it ( 50 mg) which is in the morning. But I take propanalol for that.  I have no problems with  food restrictions. Just be  careful with cold medications with a decongestant_ demerol_ etc. Even surgery is no problem if you alert anesthesiologist to what you are  taking. They know what do do_ they've had to treat patients in the ER that were on Parnate. It is the best  drug I have had and really the only one that worked for  me. My only problem is that it's very very hard to fall asleep without help_ like Ambien. But after  years_ the side  effects of  Ambien ( vivid  nightmares) have made me try all kinds of behavioral changes.
Comments: I wish I  knew what to do about the  sleeplessness problem. The only time I really  feel tired is around 4 in the afternoon. I've  stopped talking a nap_ hoping that would help later on.

Side Effects: NONE!
Comments: It is the first antidepressant that helped me for any period of time at all. I was tried on many before making a serious suicide attempt in 2004. In the hospital I was put on 60mg of Parnate_ plus Seroquel. I now take 70mg. Miraculously_ none of the prohibited foods affect me at all--red wine_ cheese_ all ok_ but that is very unusual. (I've now had some serious personal losses and am thinking of taking more--does anyone know about that?

Side Effects: daily drowsiness and lethargy_ but insomnia if taken at night_ tingling goosebumps feelings_ fast hearbeat
Comments: I have taken 50mg parnate (generic tranylcypromine) and 50mg lamictal for depression ever since I got out of the psych hospital around 6 months ago. My depression seems to have gotten much better after starting these drugs_ but unfortunately it is difficult to tell which drug is responsible for my improvement. The side effects from both of these drugs are quite bothersome. Parnate causes me to be very drowsy and lethargic during the day and I often need to lay down and rest for a few hours_ but if I take it at night or in the afternoon_ I can't sleep.

Side Effects: I have already rated parnate but I am now experiencing a new side effect I thought I would share_ insomnia.
Comments: I was taking serquel at the time of my last rating and since then it I became to tolerant of it_ I them moved on to a few more but nothing works for more then a night or 2. It seems they stimulants in parnate prevent me from sleeping days on end. It is not awful though because I do not feel tired_ and as long as its a 'good day' I enjoy the peaceful night (how long it is healthy to go without sleep though I am not sure). My doctor doesn't seem to have any suggestions either. right now i'm taking 30 mg dalmane_ it worked well (TOO WELL) for the first 2 days but then I became tolerant. When reading about it I read it was used for extreme insomnia and not to expect it to work for me then a week before tolerance builds up so I guess even the doctor is grasping as straws.

Side Effects: light headed_ fainted very often in the beginning_ sensitive to a lot of sun_ no appetite for a few days
Comments: Started parnate at 30mg (10mg 3x a day) felt better right away for about a week and a half_ then back to how i was before. Once I got to about 40mg and had been taking it 2months and added topamax_ and seraquel to sleep I felt world better. I have tried almost every anti depressent and this is the first one to have any effect what so ever good or bad. It is amazing I think. Their have been articles stating if other antidepressants don't work you usallly need a rather high dose a parnate (maybe even up to 100mg a day - very high for parnate) depending on your size. I now am at 60mg and probably won't go higher because of size but it aboslutly amazing- i am finally starting to leave the house_ slowly beginning to communicate with people again. i suggest parnate!

Side Effects: dry mouth_ agitation_ decreased appetite_ colder than usual_ initial insomnia (goes away)_ craving for sweet foods (does not go away)_ extreme fatigue in afternoon_ constipation.
Comments: Works for depression.  Not a "happy pill_" but it evens out my moods and prevents panic attacks and sporadic weeping.  However_ tends to dull the personality a bit.

Side Effects: the key to reducing side effects is to start with a low dose and work up gradually to a therapudic dose.  I do not have side effects if I am careful with the dosage_ and careful not to eat the foods that I know are my triggers. Msg. is a bad one.
Comments: I have taken Parnate for 30 years. I will never forget my initial response to the medication.  It was like waking from a bad dream and I said "where have I been"  My only quandry is what to do before major surgery.

Side Effects: SOME HEADACHE IN P.M._ RAISED PULSE RATE P.M._ BOTH POSSIBLY FOOD RELATED
Comments: MY LIFE BEGAN AFTER I STARTED TAKING PARNATE_ AFTER 16 YEARS OF TRYING SO MANY MEDS AND COMBINATIONS_AND A PURE TORTURED EXISTENCE_I FINALLY FEEL LIKE A NORMAL PERSON. I AM SO RELIEVED.

Side Effects: weight gain and loss of libido and unsteady walk.
Comments: Saved my life and now life is a joy.

Side Effects: weight gain_ blurred vision in the evening
Comments: Parnate saved my life 13 years ago. They tried other antidepressants on me and as a last resort gave me Parnate. It was a miracle drug. I got my life back. You just have to be responsible and take it as prescribed. DO NOT listen to anyone who thinks you should be off of it_ like massage_healing work_ health food experts_ EVEN FRIENDS AND FAMILY etc. They have no idea what the world is like for you without parnate. I had a bad accident and was given many pain drugs which caused a chemical inbalance when I was taken off of them.  I couldn't cope with anything_was severly depressed and had horrible"jump out of your skin" anxiety. Within three months or less of taking parnate my biggest fear was it would not keep working because I felt like a normal person again.As I said that was 13 years ago. I am still taking parnate 40mg a day.I also did a lot of research on parnate and the one thing that has always stayed in my mind was a statement in one book 'PARNATE ALWAYS WORKS.&qu

Side Effects: Dry mouth occasionally_ and I believe_heart palpitations. I have experienced increased sexual desire and it works in 24 hours. In all the years that I've been taking it_ I've had only 2 episodes because of food. I can have a little white wine or champagne; fresh cheeses; and I drink decaf anyway. For colds_ I use the menthol breathe right strips and Vicks Vaporub to keep my head clear.And I stay at home and stay in bed. It's probably a good idea to wear a medic alert bracelet--which I plan to get.
Comments: I've been taking the drug since 1979_ but usually was on it for about 1-2 years and then was off (I had a depression every 7 years). But this time around_ I've been on it for about 5 years. My doctor says that I'll probably stay on it because as you get older...you may need it more. I'm on 40 mg a day; my highest dosage was 50 mgs.  I didn't even want to try another drug because this one works and works fast. And my psychiatrist still feels that this is the right drug for me.

Side Effects: I was one of the UNlucky few who experienced the dreaded MAOI hypertensive crisis. I was very careful with the diet. My best guess is that peanut butter was the culprit - excessive peanuts are on the eat with caution list_ but not forbidden. I might just be more susceptible than most. The H/C was the worst experience of my life and landed me in the local trauma center. Started with a MAJOR headache (the type where you consider throwing yourself in front of a train to ease the pain). Blood pressure went off the scales. Took two weeks to fully recover. Be forewarned - these MAOI hypertensive crises can and do happen.
Comments: I was just getting to the maintenance dose when I had the hypertensive crisis. The drug was actually working very well up to that point and I was hopeful that I finally found one that was going to work. If only this could be designed without the tyramine issues!!

Side Effects: Always cold_ headaches sometimes_ eventually stopped working after 20 years.
Comments: I took this miracle drug for 20 years and was convinced to go off it to try newer antidepressants.  It was a nightmare to withdraw from.  If you are on it and wish to try other newer meds. DON'T.  I've tried them all and am going back to Parnate. If you can manage the food restrictions_ it is WORTH IT. Don't mess with a good thing. AND... If you are hesitant to take an MAO... go for it! If nothing else works... you will know what "real life" is like.

Side Effects: Insomnia_ delay of orgasm. Possibly intolerant/agressive sometimes (but maybe after lifetime as a virtual 'doormat'_ just flexing muscles).
Comments: In brief: Parnate has given me a whole new life. My only great fear is that I may one day have to stop taing it_ or that it will stop working. This drug_ for me_ has been like being reborn :) Fears that were crucifying me_ I now laugh about. I feel I have become the person I was meant to be.

Side Effects: Dificulty in ejaculating_ loss of libido_ became a bit aggressive and insensitive_ so I'm told.
Comments: POWER drug.  Parnate kicks ass.  I've taken them all_ and this one is in a different category.  I took it for 12 years_ and my life went from a sloppy mess to a LOT of fun.  Parnate if you're a strong responder_ and I was_ comes on with an amphetimine like minor "rush_" and you feel no fear or self doubt.  It takes bedridden disasters and turns them into hitters.  Love this shit_ but it finally petered out on it.  I'm waiting for selegiline to hit the shelves in a month or so.  MAOI's rule!!

Side Effects: I HAVE DEVELOPED SIDE EFFECTS OF MUSCLE TENSION AND DISYNESS IN THE LAST FEW YEARS . I WAS HOPEING TO GET SOME FEEDBACK ON HOW THE NEWER SAFER MEDS WORK .
Comments: UNFORTUNATLY OLD SYMPTOMS ARE COMING BACK I WILL HAVE TO TRY ANOTHER ONE OR GO BACK TO PARNATE

Side Effects: At the beginning only --hypotension_ dry mouth weight gain_ craving for carbohydrates. Ongoing--reduced need for sleep (not insomnia
Comments: I've been taking this drug for 20 (TWENTY) YEARS and it has always been a lifesaver_ in knocking out my symptoms of depression.

Side Effects: Trouble sleeping at night_ food restrictions or else severe migraine with blood pressure shooting up_ dizziness & very occasional fainting (learned to stand up slowly and eat regularly).
Comments: It's not an easy drug to take_ at high dose I have to take it 3xday and watch what I eat.  But_ after trying many other drugs over the years_ nothing has helped as much.  I am not 100%_ but I am much better than I have been for over 20 years.

Side Effects: loss of libido_ sleeplessness_ perception difficulties (bump into things with my hips)_ some difficulty
Comments: This drug is a miracle and saved my life. For the first time_ I feel like a human being after many years of suffering and trying almost all other drugs and ECT. I would probably be dead without Parnate. I take 100 mg. daily.

Side Effects: Insomnia_ afternoon fatigue_ weight gain_ altered depth perception_ sensitivity to heat_ increased libido_ leg weakness
Comments: For the first time in my life i am depression free.  I love this med and find the diet is not at all restrictive.  Very few things must be strictly avoided

Side Effects: Sleeplessness.  Also a profound fear of the
Comments: Very good med but the (welcome) alertness it give you disappears after a while.  Am taking 40mg a day and want to go higher but my doc is very reluctant.

Side Effects: Helped lift depression. Severe dizzyness spells..Fell down a few times. Dizzyness pronounced while  getting up from bed.. passing out spells
Comments: Taking fludrocortisone to help dizzyness.. Not sure how its all going to turn out. TRIED ALL SSRI before this one

Side Effects: Some insomnia at night.  Afternoon sleepiness.
Comments: The only thing that's helped my depression.  The dietary restrictions are_ in my opinion_ trivial_ compared to the relief I've gotten.  I'm not looking forward to my first cold/flu without the help of OTC drugs_ but_ again_ how does that inconveniance compare with 15 years of horrible depression finally being lifted?

Side Effects: loss of libido_ sleep disruption_ MAOI diet restriction_ afternoon fatigure attacks
Comments: very powerful AD_ the libido loss & deep fatigue (lasting ~30 min-1 hr) in the afternoon and/or early evening_ on top of the diet restrictions_ ultimately led me to go off

Side Effects: Have been on it for 15 yrs. and works well for depression. Have developed side effects of muscle tightness and dizzyness in the last few yrs. and have to switch.
Comments: This drug is difficult to switch off of if need be. As a MAOI it reguires 14 days off before another SSRI or SSNRI can be used. I would use one of the newer drugs. Good luck.

Side Effects: dry mouth_sleepines_some constipation
Comments: i have been on very long term but low dose of 20 mg a day. I take at bedtime so sleep through most side effects. No panic attacks on this med.

Side Effects: Sleeplessness
Comments: Alcohol makes you very groggy

Side Effects: None. I just had to watch my diet.
Comments: Was on this for 18 years. Worked like a charm. After this time began to get irritable easily and it was decided to change meds. Currently on remeron_ but not having much success. The old symptoms which I haven't experienced in 18 years are coming back. I feel if parnate had been invented after (instead of before) the SSRIs etc_ it may have been viewed as an improvement. on them

Side Effects: very low blood pressure
Comments: first anti-depressant that has had any effect on me at all

Side Effects: Too many to list_ but some include weight gain_ dry mouth_ blurred vision and sexual problems.
Comments: I hate it.  I am switching.

Side Effects: I am taking several meds so it is hard to say. Mostly dry mouth_ constipation_ and at first urinary hestancy.
